h2.span: Turquoise Trail Charter School Header News Feed

div.p: Xfinity has added a number of new free hotspots around town. There might be one near your home!
Go to: https://wifi.xfinity.com/ and click on 'Find a Hotspot' to locate them
Your teachers are going to contact you. If you have not heard from your teachers by Monday, March 30th, please contact the school by email at: fmargaritondo@ttschool.org or phone: 505 986 4000.
Now, more than ever, it is very important for teachers to be able to communicate with our families. Everybody from the school staff is working hard on contingency plans in these new times.
Be safe and healthy and creative.

Don't Miss Out! The Annual Pledge Drive has started again. This year the winning grade will receive a field trip! Please look for Pledge cards in your student's backpack, as well as attached to the Tuesday email and here. (see attached below). Send these to everybody you know. Donations can be done electronically by Credit Card, so from anywhere in the world.

span.strong: TTCS Food program, 10:30AM - 12:30PM, MWF. Grab and go at the Staff parking lot

p.span: Please check here and your email often for communications from the school

span.strong: Volleyball, Swim Team and Wrestling are also cancelled till further notice

div.p: Xfinity has added a number of new free hotspots around town. There might be one near your home!
Go to: https://wifi.xfinity.com/ and click on 'Find a Hotspot' to locate them
Your teachers are going to contact you. If you have not heard from your teachers by Monday, March 30th, please contact the school by email at: fmargaritondo@ttschool.org or phone: 505 986 4000.
Now, more than ever, it is very important for teachers to be able to communicate with our families. Everybody from the school staff is working hard on contingency plans in these new times.
Be safe and healthy and creative.

Don't Miss Out! The Annual Pledge Drive has started again. This year the winning grade will receive a field trip! Please look for Pledge cards in your student's backpack, as well as attached to the Tuesday email and here. (see attached below). Send these to everybody you know. Donations can be done electronically by Credit Card, so from anywhere in the world.

div.div: We regret to confirm that TTCS , like all schools in NM will be closed for all grades, for the remainder of the school year. We have already begun "continuous learning" for all of our TTCS students in k-8. If you have not heard from your classroom teacher by now-please call the school and let us know. We may need to update your email and phone information.
We are NOW serving FREE meals to all TTCS families M-Friday and may re-start Child Care for all TTCS families with children in grades k-5. from 10-5:30 PM. look for a survey and a sign up this week.

All teachers and EAs are available during the week (excluding holidays and weekends), by phone and email and will have office hours for you to contact them. Many types of "direct instruction" will be delivered to all students in all grades.

If you have questions, Please feel free to call our school as we are answering calls from 8am - 3:30pm daily. Everyone will have questions during this unprecedented time and we are here to help you through this crisis.

span.strong: Snow Delay and Closure Announcements are made in the following methods:
TTCS Website, TV = KOAT and KOB

strong.span: If Santa FE Public Schools has a Snow delay or closure, there's a good chance TTCS will as well, however we reserve the right to proceed for safety.

h4.span: Please do not park and leave your car in the fire/drop off lane

Do not park in the Staff parking lot to drop off or pick up students, the busses cannot always see children on that side of their bus, especially since they are focussed on the ones getting on or off their bus.

br.span: Do not use cell phones while driving, especially in the parent drive up areas.
No parking in the handicap spaces unless you have a visible handicap card in your front window
Drive very slowly in the parent pickup
Sign in at the front office and get a visitor's badge before you walk down halls of the school
Don't put rocks in doorways to hold open doors.
Make sure students are in the car and seated before driving away
Make sure car door is closed before driving away at drop off
Do not leave children or animals in cars unattended
